Description: Employee sent email with customer contact list to wrong recipient (external)
Containment Actions: Recalled email (recipient confirmed deletion and non-disclosure); contacted recipient to confirm deletion and request confirmation; documented in breach register
Investigation Findings: Email client auto-complete selected wrong recipient; customer contact list attached to email
Root Cause: Human error; insufficient care when selecting email recipient; auto-complete in email client selected similarly-named contact
Remediation Actions: Contacted recipient (confirmed deletion; signed confirmation); reviewed email for any other sensitive data (none); reminded all staff about email security (company-wide reminder sent)
Measures to Prevent Recurrence: Staff training reinforced (double-check recipients for confidential emails); implement email DLP warning for large attachments (future enhancement); consider disabling auto-complete for external addresses
Residual Risk to Individuals: Low (recipient trustworthy; confirmed deletion; no sensitive beyond contact details)
Notes: ICO notification not required: low risk to individuals (only contact details; recipient confirmed deletion); documented decision with rationale; no regulatory action needed

Description: Description of what happened and how breach occurred
Data Categories: List data categories (names emails addresses financial health)
Containment Actions: What was done immediately to stop breach
Measures to Prevent Recurrence: How we'll prevent similar breaches in future
